body.p: Before you burp, gas associated with swallowing and digestion will first accumulate in what superior portion of the stomach?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The gas will pass through this small area as it moves backwards through the lower esophageal sphincter.
Correct. The dome of the fundus allows gas to accumulate above the chyme mixing in the body of the stomach.
Incorrect. The chyme fills the pyloric antrum and canal to be passed on to the small intestine.
Incorrect. Tthe chyme fills this large, central portion of the stomach.

part.hint: Gas and air will “float” relative to the liquid stomach contents.
